reimbursementClaim.name: Discharge summary (with details of complaint & treatment availed)
Final hospital bill (with detailed break-up), along with interim bills & payment receipts
All investigation reports (blood reports, X-rays, sonography, CT scan, MRI etc)
All pharmacy bills supported by doctor s prescription
Implant sticker / invoice, if used (eg: lens details in cataract case, stent details in angioplasty)
In specific cases, a Medico Legal Certificate (MLC) is needed. An FIR copy is required for all accidental cases.
In case of miscellaneous charges, we require bills with supporting prescription of the treating doctor

blogArticles.title: Health Insurance Options for Low Income Individuals
blogArticles.description: Health insurance options for low-income individuals include various government schemes and affordable plans. Coverage provides essential medical protection with specific eligibility criteria.

blogArticles.title: Guide to Individual vs Family Insurance Deductibles
blogArticles.description: Individual and family deductibles differ in coverage scope and cost implications. Understanding these differences helps choose appropriate health insurance plans for personal or family needs.

blogArticles.title: Understanding Family Health Insurance Deductibles
blogArticles.description: Comprehensive explanation of family health insurance deductibles covering terms conditions and practical considerations for policy selection and usage.
